page.title: 14THE PEOPLE OF PETT LEVEL I
page.content: Householders in this area are in the main, retired people. Any who are still employed would go out of the area to work.There are farmers, but no farm labourers, two doctors still in practice live here, but there is no surgery. One policeman, shared by other parishes, patrols the area. There are approximately 20 children of school age who would attend Guestling Primary or Thomas Peacocke Secondary School in Rye. There is no organised social life, but the impression I get when talking to the people is-they would not want to live anywhere else.
